basics.name: Iván de Paz Centeno
basics.label: PhD in Computer Science (Artificial Intelligence)
basics.summary: Iván de Paz Centeno is a computer scientist from Spain, holding a Ph.D. in Computer Science with a specialization in Artificial Intelligence. He has made significant scientific contributions to the field of Artificial Intelligence. Currently based in León, Castilla y León, Spain, Iván has a robust background in both industry and academia. His expertise lies in developing Artificial Intelligence models for various applications, focusing on energy time series analysis, computer vision, and machine learning. He is a dedicated learner, problem solver, and collaborator, known for delivering impactful solutions.

work.name: SMARKIA ENERGY SL
work.position: Data Scientist and Machine Learning Engineer
work.summary: Research into creation of Artificial Intelligence models applied to energy time series.
highlights: Topics covered: data quality improvement (absence imputation, granularity standarization, super-resolution, anomaly detection)
Python, Pandas, Numpy, TensorFlow, Scikit-learn, Jupyter notebooks, Matplotlib, Plotly
Azure Machine Learning, Azure Blob Storage, Azure Container Apps

work.name: University of Leon / INCIBE
work.position: Researcher in Computer Vision and Machine Learning
work.summary: Research into creation of computer vision models based on Deep Learning applied to cybersecurity contexts in police environments.
highlights: Topics covered: face detection, age and gender estimation, face recognition
Computer Vision, Machine Learning and Deep Learning
Python, Caffe, OpenCV, OpenBR, TensorFlow, Flask, Docker

work.name: INDRA
work.summary: Development of an Android system for remote management of physical signal jammers designed for Spanish state law enforcement agencies.

work.name: University of Leon
work.summary: Development of a portable artificial intelligence system comprising face detection, recognition and age and gender estimation, designed for small appliances.
highlights: Topics covered: face detection, face recognition, age estimation, gender estimation
Python, OpenCV, OpenBR, HTML, Javascript, JQuery, CSS

work.name: Hewlett-Packard
work.summary: Development of a surveillance solution for remote cameras to detect movement, store video in the cloud and notify clients with alarms.
highlights: Topics covered: IP/USB Cameras, codecs for video compression, data storage, phone events
C#, Java, Android, HTML, Javascript, JQuery, CSS

courses: Artificial Intelligence, Machine Learning, Deep Learning
Energy Time Series, Energy Load Profiles, Photovoltaic Systems
Forecasting, Comparison, Synthesis, Prediction, Anomaly detection, Clustering

awards.title: PhD Dissertation with Distinction
awards.summary: Received a Cum Laude award for the PhD dissertation with an industrial mention.

awards.title: Extraordinary End-of-Career Award
awards.summary: Honored with the Extraordinary End-of-Career Award for the Master's degree in Computer Science.

awards.title: 1st Position in Hack2Progress
awards.summary: Achieved the first position in the Hack2Progress 2016 hackathon held in Santander, Spain.

awards.title: 2nd Position in HackForGood
awards.summary: Secured the second position in the HackForGood 2016 hackathon held in León, Spain.

awards.title: Best IT Project
awards.summary: Received an award for developing the best IT project for the HP Observatory in 2015, located in León, Spain.

certificates.name: Improving Deep Neural Networks: Hyperparameter tuning, Regularization and Optimization

A Granularity Invariant Method for the Classification of Energy Production Time Series in Photovoltaic Plants

M-SRPCNN: A Fully Convolutional Neural Network Approach for Handling Super Resolution Reconstruction on Monthly Energy Consumption Environments
